body:
## Profile
### IT industry
Takashi Toyoshima is a software engineer at Google working on the Google Chrome Web browser. He works on WebSocket, SPDY, and NaCl.

He was a researcher at Fujitsu Laboratories Limited working on the [K computer](http://www.fujitsu.com/global/about/tech/k/), and developed a main component, [ICC: An Interconnect Controller for the Tofu Interconnect Architecture](http://www.hotchips.org/wp-content/uploads/hc_archives/archive22/HC22.24.510-1-Toyoishima-Tofu-icc.pdf) as a design team lead and a hardware engineer at Fujitsu Limited.

His major concerns are computer systems, especially on microprocessors and networks.
He received M.S. in information science and technology from the University of Tokyo in 2006, and B.S. in electronic engineering from the University of Tokyo in 2004.

He was a board member of IPSJ SIGARC from 2008 to 2011. He is a member of the ACM, IPSJ, and IEICE. He is a committer for Chrome, WebKit, and Ruby.

### Game industry
I worked with [M2](http://www.mtwo.co.jp/) and joined in the development for following games.

+ DigiCommunication
+ DigiCommunication 2
+ SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.20 Space Harrier Complete Collection
+ SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.21 SEGA System 16 Collection: SDK & Quartet
+ SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.25 Gunstar Heroes, Treasure Box
+ SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.28 Tetris Collection
+ SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.29 Monster World Complete Collection
+ SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.30 Galaxy Force II Special Extended Edition
+ SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.32 Phantasy Star Complete Collection
+ SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.33 Fantasy Zone Complete Collection
+ KONAMI Twinbee Portable
+ KONAMI Salamander Portable

## Interests
My favorite technologies are openFrameworks, Web Audio API, WebGL, and Google NativeClient.
